segment.documentation: BGM, A segment to indicate the beginning of a message and to transmit identifying number and message function.
FTX, A segment to specify free form or processable supplementary information, such as: - change information
RFF, A segment to express a reference which applies to the entire message, such as: - reference to previous message - container announcement reference number

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 1: A group of segments to indicate details of the movement of containers.

segment.documentation: TDT, A segment to indicate information related to the main carriage stage of the transport (sea), such as carrier/liner service.
LOC, A segment to indicate a port corresponding to the transport stage, such as port of loading or discharge.
DTM, A segment to indicate a date/time relating to the transport details, such as arrival date/time.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 2: A group of segments to identify a party and related contacts.

segment.documentation: NAD, A segment to identify the party's name, address, and function, such as: - message recipient - message sender - ordering customer - ordering customer agent
CTA, A segment to identify a person or department for the party, such as: - information contact

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 3: A group of segments to describe the goods items stuffed in containers.

segment.documentation: GID, A segment to identify a goods item stuffed in containers. A goods item can be identified by a goods item number.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 4: A group of segments to specify documents and associated date(s) and time(s) for a goods item.

segment.documentation: DOC, A segment to specify a document prepared for a goods item.
DTM, A segment to associate issue and expiry date with the prepared document.
SGP, A segment to identify the containers in which goods are transported.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 5: A group of segments to specify containers in which goods are transported.

segment.documentation: EQD, A segment to specify container prefix and number.
RFF, A segment to specify the identifying number associated with a container, such as: - container sequence number
NAD, A segment to specify a pick-up address of Customs documents.
CNT, A segment to specify the number of containers in the message, explicitly given by the sender.
